column4: KaKaRoTo: It seems that hibernate and suspend don't always work too well in Ubuntu.
well, I did add the sound modules to /etc/apci/suspend.d/70-modules-unload .. but it's not working even after a full shutdown
modules load correctly, alsamixer works, everything seems normal, but when I play something, I hear nothing
Make sure alsa mixer is output device See below
Did you see the steps ubotu supplied, did you look at that?
but I don't think that's the problem.. I use aplay on wav files
also, it works sometimes, and sometimes it doesn't, so it's a total mystery..
Try opening alsamixer and make sure everything is max, and also that if you need amplification it's on.
it's already checked, and everything is already maxed out
last time, crimsun said it was a codec issue not being intialized, so I added probe_mask=3 to the snd-hda-intel module loading options, and it worked, but now, even this trick doesn't seem to work
If that is the case, this problem might be beyond my ability to solve.
